channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Due process does look different': DHS official defends deportation of Maryland man
item.description: The Trump administration has defended the deportation of Maryland man mistakenly sent to El Salvador.

item.title: Tariffs are fueling fears of a recession. What does it take to actually declare one?
item.description: The Trump administration's tariffs are fueling concerns about a potential recession, with several major banks increasing their forecasts. What is rece...

item.title: Wall Street leaders warn of harsh economic consequences from Trump's tariffs
item.description: The business sector has tried to avoid criticizing Trump in public and welcomed his vows of lower taxes and deregulation, but the market sell-off appe...

item.title: They had left their DEI roles. Trump still fired them
item.description: The Trump administration is firing hundreds and perhaps thousands of federal workers as part of a crackdown on diversity, equity and inclusion efforts...

item.title: Deadline looms in case of Maryland man's wrongful deportation to El Salvador
item.description: The Trump administration is asking the Supreme Court to lift a midnight deadline to return Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the Maryland man who was deported to ...

item.title: US bishops halt partnerships with federal government on aid programs, citing funding cuts
Trump asks US Supreme Court to block return of wrongly deported man
item.description: The administration argues that El Salvador cannot be compelled to return Mr Kilmar Abrego Garcia to the US.

item.title: Red Crescent calls for inquiry into Israel's killing of Gaza paramedics
item.description: The organisation says the attack by Israeli troops on a convoy of ambulances constitutes a "fully-fledged war crime".

item.title: Gaza air strikes follow heaviest rocket fire by Hamas in months
item.description: A journalist is reportedly killed in a strike at a hospital compound after 10 rockets are fired into Israel.

item.title: Visually impaired Bronx native training for TD Five Boro Bike Tour
item.description: A visually impaired man in the Bronx is riding out of his comfort zone as he trains to participate in the TD Five Boro Bike Tour.

item.title: U.S. stock futures sag, overseas markets plunge as tariff turmoil continues
item.description: Stocks in the U.S. look set for another for another rough outing Monday as the Trump tariff fallout continues to roil global markets.

item.title: Apr 7: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: President Trump says he will impose new tariffs on China if Xi Jinping does not withdraw retaliatory tariffs; Stocks tumble as global markets feel the...

item.title: "Doomsday mom" Lori Vallow Daybell's Arizona trial underway
item.description: Opening statements in Lori Vallow Daybell's trial in Arizona began Monday. She is charged in the death of her fourth husband, Charles Vallow.

item.title: Apr 3: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: President Trump slaps minimum 10% tariffs on all U.S. trading partners; Cat reunited with homeowner months after Palisades Fire in Southern California...

item.title: Swollen rivers are flooding towns in the US South after a prolonged deluge of rain
item.description: Rivers rose and flooding worsened across the U.S. South and Midwest, threatening communities already waterlogged and badly damaged by days of heavy ra...

item.title: Dozens die after torrential rain hammers Congolese capital
item.description: Kinshasa is prone to soil erosion and the president warned the climate crisis is making flooding worse.

item.title: Belgian prince loses bid for benefits on top of Â£300k royal allowance
item.description: Court rejects claim by Prince Laurent, who said he was acting out of "principle" rather than for money.

item.title: RFK Jr. visits epicenter of Texas measles outbreak after death of second child who was infected
